edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class CometsToolbarPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.CometsToolbarPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CometsToolbarPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This implements a toolbar for use with the CometsSetupPanel. The toolbar is designed to be analogous to tool palettes common to paint programs and Photoshop, for example. The idea here is that the user can use these tools to "paint" the world with biomass, media, and barrier spaces.

A series of tools (extensions of AbstractTool) is instantiated and linked to a set of buttons that reside in the main section of the toolbar. Each of these tools has its own control panel (as required by the AbstractTool which gets temporarily added to the toolbar when the user selects each tool.

Many of these tools implement some kind of mechanic for adding biomass, media, etc. to the world through interacting with the CometsSetupPanel. The content added is saved in the CometsToolbarPanel for use across all such tools.

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:
AbstractTool, EraserTool, FillTool, GradientTool, PencilTool, PipetTool, SelectTool, ShapeTool, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

CometsToolbarPanel

public CometsToolbarPanel(Comets c,
                          CometsSetupPanel csp)
Creates a new CometsToolbarPanel linked to the given CometsSetupPanel and Comets objects. This automatically initializes the set of tools to be used and sets the SelectTool to be initially active.

Parameters:
c - - the main Comets object.
csp - - the associated CometsSetupPanel
Method Detail

clearContent

public void clearContent()
This removes any previously set biomass and media content that was set by the user, resetting it to be all zeros.

getBiomassPanel

public DataContentPanel getBiomassPanel()
This returns a DataContentPanel with biomass information fetched from the Comets object. This panel has text fields that allow the user to set how much of each biomass should be added.

Returns:
a DataContentPanel with biomass information.

getMediaPanel

public DataContentPanel getMediaPanel()
This returns a DataContentPanel with media information fetched from the Comets object. This panel has text fields that allow the user to set how much of each nutrient should be added.

Returns:
a DataContentPanel with media information.

setupMediaPanel

public void setupMediaPanel()
This sets up the internal DataContentPanel that stores information about the media content that should be placed into the world by various tools (line, shape, pencil, etc.).

It fetches all the information it needs from the Models that are loaded into the Comets object.

setBarrier

public void setBarrier(boolean b)
This sets all tools' content to add (or remove) a barrier from the next place it's used on the CometsSetupPanel

Parameters:
b - - if true, the next place a tool is used will become a barrier

getBarrier

public boolean getBarrier()
Returns the state of each tool with regard to placing barriers in the world.

Returns:
true if the next tool use will place a barrier in the world.

showContentSettings

public void showContentSettings()
This builds and shows a model dialog that allows the user to change the biomass and media content that will be added to the world when various tools are used. Each of these settings are dictated by what Models and how many of them are loaded.

showLayoutToolbar

public void showLayoutToolbar(boolean b)
Shows or hides the layout toolbar.

Parameters:
b - - if true, shows the toolbar, otherwise hides it.

getActiveTool

public AbstractTool getActiveTool()
Returns the currently active tool as an AbstractTool. So if you know what tool you're grabbing, you'll have to cast it before calling tool-specific methods.

Returns:
the currently selected AbstractTool

snapShapeToGrid

public void snapShapeToGrid(java.awt.Shape s,
                            int style)
One of the problems with having a world full of arbitrarily sized boxes that represent overgrown pixels is that any shape used to draw on that world might take up a fraction of a space. We can't really select only part of a space, or only put biomass in a piece of a space, so to make it easier for the user to see what's happening, we tweak the drawn shape to fully encapsulate grid spaces.

This method uses the dimensions of the shape and the size of each grid space to adjust the shape so that it "snaps" around individual grid spaces.

This works best, obviously, for rectangular shapes. Circular shapes should be turned into kinda pixelated round things, but for now they remain round, except that their bounding rectangles are snapped to the grid.

Parameters:
s - - the shape to be snapped to the grid
style - - the style of the shape: one of CometsSetupPanel.BOX_STYLE, CometsSetupPanel.CIRCLE_STYLE or CometsSetupPanel.LINE_STYLE.

getShapePoints

public java.util.ArrayList getShapePoints(java.awt.Shape s,
                                          boolean intersect)
Builds and returns an ArrayList of Points corresponding to the world spaces whose center is found within the given Shape (this isn't the best way, but works as a good heuristic for those pesky round shapes). Alternately, if the intersect parameter is set to true, those spaces that are intersected by the Shape are returned - useful for using a thin line to select spaces.

Parameters:
s - - spaces contained by this Shape are returned.
intersect - - if set to true, then any space intersected by the shape is returned.
Returns:
an ArrayList of Points contained by the Shape
